sen.j: とびこ（飛子）とは、魚類卵加工食品の一つ。
sen.e: Tobiko is one kind of processed fish eggs.
Tobiko is one kind of processed fish eggs.
Tobiko is one kind of processed fish eggs.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに基づき修正

sen.j: とびこはトビウオ（飛魚）の卵を塩漬けにしたもの。
sen.e: Tobiko is salted eggs of flying fish.
Tobiko is the salted roe of the flying fish.
sen.cmt: is salted egg of flying fish→is the salted roe of the flying fishとしました。
sen.e: Tobiko is the salted roe of the flying fish.

sen.j: イクラより小粒で透き通った黄金色の小さい球状の卵の集合体である。
sen.e: They are smaller than salmon roes and an assembly of transparent, golden small spherical eggs.
Tobiko is smaller than salmon roe and an assembly of transparent, golden small spherical eggs.
sen.cmt: They are→Tobiko is、salmon roes→salmon roeとしました。
sen.e: Tobiko is smaller than salmon roe and an assembly of transparent, golden small spherical eggs.

sen.j: サイズは個々の卵のおよその直径で1ミリメートル前後、皮が固く、噛むと粒がはじける感触を楽しめる。
sen.e: The size of each egg is 1 mm or so in diameter and the peel is so solid that chewing and bursting feelings are enjoyable.
The size of each egg is 1 mm or so in diameter and the peel is so solid that chewing and bursting feelings are enjoyable.
The size of each egg is 1 mm or so in diameter and the peel is so solid that chewing and bursting feelings are enjoyable.

sen.j: おもに寿司の寿司ネタとして利用され、ちらし寿司や軍艦巻で食べられる。
sen.e: They are mainly used for sushi item and eaten in chirashizushi (vinegared rice topped with sliced raw fish, shrimp, egg, vegetables, and others) and gunkan-maki roll (vinegared rice topped with various ingredients rolled in a sheet of dried laver).

Tobiko is mainly used for sushi item and eaten in chirashizushi (vinegared rice topped with sliced raw fish, shrimp, egg, vegetables, and others) and gunkan-maki roll (vinegared rice topped with various ingredients rolled in a sheet of dried laver).

Tobiko is mainly used for sushi item and eaten in chirashizushi (vinegared rice topped with sliced raw fish, shrimp, egg, vegetables, and others) and gunkan-maki roll (vinegared rice topped with various ingredients rolled in a sheet of dried laver).

sen.j: 「とびこ」のほか「とびっこ」の表記もあるが、こちらは水産加工会社のかね徳（本社・兵庫県芦屋市）の製品として商標登録されているため、「飛卵」（とびらん）のような表記で売られていることがある。
sen.e: "Tobiko" is also written as "Tobikko", but sold in the name of such as "Tobiran" because "Tobikko" is a registered trademark of the product by a fish processing company, Kanetoku (HQ is in Ashiya City, Hyogo Prefecture).

Tobiko' is also written as 'Tobikko,' but sold in the name of such as 'Tobiran' because 'Tobikko' is a registered trademark of the product by a fish processing company, Kanetoku (HQ is in Ashiya City, Hyogo Prefecture).
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を移動、シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Tobiko' is also written as 'Tobikko,' but sold in the name of such as 'Tobiran' because 'Tobikko' is a registered trademark of the product by a fish processing company, Kanetoku (HQ is in Ashiya City, Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: 現在はインドネシアなどの南方海域からの輸入品が多い。
sen.e: Nowadays there are many imported products from the southern waters such as Indonesia.
Nowadays there are many imported products from the southern waters such as Indonesia.
Nowadays there are many imported products from the southern waters such as Indonesia.

sen.j: ゴールデンキャビアの名前でカナッペなどにされる他、黒く着色した製品は人工キャビアとして利用される。
sen.e: They are processed into "canape" in the name of "Golden caviar" and the black-colored products are used as artificial caviar.
They are processed into a product named "Golden caviar" which is used for canapes etc., and the black-colored products are used as artificial caviar.
sen.cmt: 「カナッペなどにされる」→カナッペ自体に加工されるのではなく、「具財にされる」という意味であると解釈し、一部訳し直しました。
sen.e: They are processed into a product named "Golden caviar" which is used for canapes etc., and the black-colored products are used as artificial caviar.

sen.j: なお、代用品としてシシャモの卵を使用した「ししゃもっこ」がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, there is also a substitute called "Shishamokko", which used eggs of shishamo smelt.
Furthermore, there is also a substitute called 'Shishamokko,' which uses eggs of shishamo smelt.
sen.cmt: used→usesとし、カンマの位置を移動、シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Furthermore, there is also a substitute called 'Shishamokko,' which uses eggs of shishamo smelt.
